'''Instant mining''', or just '''insta-mining''', is a game mechanic in which 1 [[block]] can be [[breaking|broken]] per [[game tick]] without the delay of {{frac|3|10}} of a second (6 ticks). Blocks that break instantly without using tools do not decrease durability if a tool is used. Below are listed the tool [[tier]] and the [[Efficiency]] and [[Haste]] levels necessary to instant-mine a block.

== History ==
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.3.1|dev=12w18a|The 6-tick ({{frac|3|10}} second) delay between block breaking is now removed if a block takes 1 tick or less to break in Survival. The player can now instantly mine a large amount of blocks in Survival simply by holding {{control|destroy}} if conditions are met.
|Before this version, blocks that can be instantly mined do break instantly, but the 6-tick delay between block breaking still exists.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=12w24a|While holding a block-breaking [[tool]], breaking a block that can be instantly mined by hand no longer reduces the tool's [[durability]].}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.4.2|dev=12w32a|With the addition of [[beacons]], the [[haste]] status effect can be legitimately accessed in survival, which enables the instant mining of [[stone]] using a [[diamond pickaxe]] enchanted with [[Efficiency]] V, making the acquisition of resources and clearing out a large area/volume much easier.}}
}}
